results.title: 13th
results.brief_description: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

constellations_other.name: The world's end
constellations_other.description: For people of colour oppressed by systemic racism, genre stories about the end of the world and cosmological monsters can be used to re-examine race and the injustices faced in real life.

constellations_other.name: Confronting injustice on-screen
constellations_other.description: The Black Lives Matter movement and the treatment of African Americans at the hands of authorities is explored in this Constellation that connects hip-hop, the Civil Rights Movement and representation in Hollywood.

results.description: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

results.title: 13 cantos of hell: images from the divine comedy of Dante
results.creator_credit: Experimental Committee of the British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An animated film based on episodes from Dante’s Inferno. The film is the work of the young artist Peter King, who was formerly associated with Lotte Reininger, famous for her silhouette films. A similar technique is used in this film in which the animated figures have a sculptural form. They display a highly individual visual imagination complemented by compelling sound.
results.title_for_label: 13 cantos of hell: images from the divine comedy of Dante

results.title: 12th Tokyo Motor Show: 1965
results.brief_description: The annual Tokyo Motor Show displays the progress of the Japanese motor industry to the nation and visitors from overseas. A wide variety of vehicles are manufactured in Japan and this annual event creates great interest from business people and car enthusiasts. Planned by the Japan Motor Industrial Federation.

results.title: 125th anniversary of Tolmie Sports: Feb 2011
results.brief_description: The Tolmie Sports is a celebration of community and High Country Heritage. A yearly event, it draws people from far and wide to the tiny town of Tolmie in north-eastern Victoria, to revel in events such as the Wood Chop, Equestrian Sports, and the epic and highly elaborate Three Man Race. “Old-Timers” Mick, Don and Sheila reflect on the history of the event, and some of its more colourful days. 2011 marked the 125th anniversary of the sports, and Tolmie Sports Committee Vice President explains some of the planning that goes into an event of its kind.

results.title: 12,000 men
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This powerful documentary brings alive the brave story of Cape Breton’s union struggles in the coal and steel industries from the 1890s through the labour wars of the 1920s. The fight for decent wages and improved working conditions took on an urgency when the British Empire Steel Corporation, or BESCO, bought every single steel and coal company in Nova Scotia. When the Montreal-based company cut wages by a third, a long and bitter dispute began. The lockouts, picket lines and strikes were finally ended by brute force when provincial police and federal troops were sent in. The mine owners, however, were ultimately forced to recognize the union. This film combines vintage footage, photographs, drawings and interviews with men and women who were actually in the pits and on the front lines. These Cape Bretoners speak of the hardship and brief victories of the coal miners and their families. Photography by Martin Duckworth. Editing by Martin Duckworth and Shelagh Mackenzie. Sound by Patricia Kipping. Voice and narration by Kenzie MacNeil. (Awards: Yorkton)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Duckworth, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: 12 Angry men
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, Terence A. Donnelly and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A young man is accused of fatally stabbing his father, and his fate now lies in the hands of his “peers”: 12 men from all walks of life, different backgrounds, who all bring their own agendas and prejudices with them. Is he innocent or guilty? Is there reasonable doubt? The tension mounts as each piece of evidence is examined again and again. This film provides the viewer with an insight into the American legal system and what may happen behind the scenes of any murder trial. This is an emotionally charged courtroom drama with a star studded cast including Courtney B Vance, Ossie Davis, George C Scott, Armin Mueller-Stahl, Dorian Harewood, James Gandolfini, Tony Danza, Jack Lemon, Hume Croyn, Mykelti Williamson, Edward James and Olmas William Peterson.

results.title: 11.59: last minute to choose
results.brief_description: A study of the social and psychological factors involved in drug abuse. Various sections of the drug culture are contrasted using split screen techniques. “11:59” brings you into the hospital emergency room, the teenagers are shown in frank discussion groups, exploring attitudes and seeking solutions. WARNING: Contains footage of drug use, overdose and emergency treatment in hospitals.

results.title: 11 Steps to Survival
results.creator_credit: Pierre L'Amare, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film demonstrating steps to take in the event of a nuclear attack. Animated drawings show the effects of atomic explosions in the air and at ground level. How wide an area is affected by light and heat flash, radiation and radio-active fall-out is clearly illustrated. How to build or improvise a fall-out shelter, what to stock in it, when to take shelter and how long to stay there are similarly explained.

results.title: 11 09 01: September 11
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu, Danis Tanovic, Samira Makhmalbaf, Sean Penn, Idrissa Ouedraogo, Mira Nair, Ken Loach, Claude Lelouch, Shohei Imamura, Amos Gitai, Youssef Chahine, Studio Canal and Galatee Films
results.brief_description: Eleven renowned directors were given the brief to create a short films that in some way responded to the tragic events of September 11, 2001, when America was thrown into disarray by the terrorist attacks on, among other targets, the Twin Towers. The only proviso was that each film be eleven minutes, nine seconds and one frame long. The directors invited to participate were: Yussef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shohei Imamura, Claude Lelouch, Ken Loach, Mira Nair, Idrissa Ouedraogo, Sean Penn, Samira Makhmalbaf, Danis Tanovic, and Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu. The results are very mixed — from the abstract to the obvious — and the overall piece did not meet with great acclaim. Regardless, the project has some insightful moments, in particular, the segments from Ken Loach, Mira Nair and Samira Makhmalbaf.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu, Danis Tanovic, Samira Makhmalbaf, Sean Penn, Idrissa Ouedraogo, Mira Nair, Ken Loach, Claude Lelouch, Shohei Imamura, Amos Gitai, Youssef Chahine, Studio Canal and Galatee Films

results.title: 11-11: MEMORIES RETOLD
results.brief_description: 11th November 1916, a young photographer leaves Canada to join the western front in Europe. The same day, a German technician is told that his son is missing in action. Both want to preserve their humanity and come back alive to their loved ones.

constellations_other.name: Painting pictures
constellations_other.description: Painter and photographer Louis Le Prince was inspired to develop the technology to make animated pictures by the circular panoramic paintings of his friends. His films captured everyday life and alluded to his artistic vision for cinema.
